page.title: 02LANDSCAPE Routes
page.content:
The spire of the church marks the junction of the higher ground to the west and the flat fen land to the east.The flight paths of the numerous local R.A.F.station aircraft pass close to this landmark and also close to the other outstanding feature, the unique eight sailed windmill.Aircraft from the U.S.A.F. bases in Norfolk and Suffolk overfly the village and surrounding farmland every day.
The {A17,}the main east-west route through mid-Lincolnshire,formed the village high street.It is the link between the north and east {Midlands } and the holiday resorts of { {Lincolnshire }and {East Anglia.}All heavy goods and holiday traffic travelling between these areas was channelled through the narrow village streets until the opening of a by-pass
